result.execSummary:
The defendant Marshall T Andrews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifucated sentence.
Must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment or part-time employment if enrolled in school.  Must attend each and every class, without truancy or tardies, if attending school.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Continue current treatment program and participate in other counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber for treatment/counseling, employment and school.  Do not report to the jail late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

CO-SIGNATURE BOND WITH MARLA MYER, DOB 7-18-42.
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the addresses 5321 4 mile Rd. and 5822 Windstar Lane. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Sentencing hearing on August 4, 2014 at 09:30 am.
